alert.note: Alert for Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 6:54PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN WARREN COUNTY THROUGH 730 PM EDT... At 652 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over western Warren County near Spring Creek, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation possible. Locations impacted include... Columbus, Youngsville, Russell, Spring Creek, Lottsville, Garland, Grand Valley, Sugar Grove and Bear Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Very heavy rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for north central Pennsylvania.
